013package org.apache.juneau.bean.html5;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.HtmlFormat.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.XmlFormat.*;
018
019import java.net.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.html.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.*;
027
028/**
029 * Superclass for all HTML elements.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * These are beans that when serialized using {@link HtmlSerializer} generate valid HTML5 elements.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
035 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanHtml5">juneau-bean-html5</a>
036
037 * </ul>
038 */
039@org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.Html(format=XML)
040@FluentSetters
041public abstract class HtmlElement {
042
043   private java.util.Map<String,Object> attrs;
044
045   /**
046    * The attributes of this element.
047    *
048    * @return The attributes of this element.
049    */
050   @Xml(format=ATTRS)
051   @Beanp("a")
052   public java.util.Map<String,Object> getAttrs() {
053      return attrs;
054   }
055
056   /**
057    * Sets the attributes for this element.
058    *
059    * @param attrs The new attributes for this element.
060    * @return This object.
061    */
062   @Beanp("a")
063   public HtmlElement setAttrs(java.util.Map<String,Object> attrs) {
064      if (attrs != null) {
065         attrs.entrySet().forEach(x -> {
066            var key = x.getKey();
067            if ("url".equals(key) || "href".equals(key) || key.endsWith("action"))
068               x.setValue(StringUtils.toURI(x.getValue()));
069         });
070      }
071      this.attrs = attrs;
072      return this;
073   }
074
075   /**
076    * Adds an arbitrary attribute to this element.
077    *
078    * @param key The attribute name.
079    * @param val The attribute value.
080    * @return This object.
081    */
082   public HtmlElement attr(String key, Object val) {
083      if (attrs == null)
084         attrs = map();
085      if (val == null)
086         attrs.remove(key);
087      else {
088         if ("url".equals(key) || "href".equals(key) || key.endsWith("action"))
089            val = StringUtils.toURI(val);
090         attrs.put(key, val);
091      }
092      return this;
093   }
094
095   /**
096    * Adds an arbitrary URI attribute to this element.
097    *
098    * <p>
099    * Same as {@link #attr(String, Object)}, except if the value is a string that appears to be a URI
100    * (e.g. <js>"servlet:/xxx"</js>).
101    *
102    * <p>
103    * The value can be of any of the following types: {@link URI}, {@link URL}, {@link String}.
104    * Strings must be valid URIs.
105    *
106    * <p>
107    * URIs defined by {@link UriResolver} can be used for values.
108    *
109    * @param key The attribute name.
110    * @param val The attribute value.
111    * @return This object.
112    */
113   public HtmlElement attrUri(String key, Object val) {
114      if (attrs == null)
115         attrs = map();
116      attrs.put(key, StringUtils.toURI(val));
117      return this;
118   }
119
120   /**
121    * Returns the attribute with the specified name.
122    *
123    * @param key The attribute name.
124    * @return The attribute value, or <jk>null</jk> if the named attribute does not exist.
125    */
126   public String getAttr(String key) {
127      return getAttr(String.class, key);
128   }
129
130   /**
131    * Returns the attribute with the specified name converted to the specified class type.
132    *
133    * @param <T> The class type to convert this class to.
134    * @param type
135    *    The class type to convert this class to.
136    *    See {@link ConverterUtils} for a list of supported conversion types.
137    * @param key The attribute name.
138    * @return The attribute value, or <jk>null</jk> if the named attribute does not exist.
139    */
140   public <T> T getAttr(Class<T> type, String key) {
141      return attrs == null ? null : ConverterUtils.toType(attrs.get(key), type);
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#the-accesskey-attribute">accesskey</a>
146    * attribute.
147    *
148    * <p>
149    * Defines a keyboard shortcut to activate or focus an element.
150    * The value should be a single character that, when pressed with a modifier key (usually Alt),
151    * activates the element.
152    *
153    * @param accesskey The keyboard shortcut character (e.g., <js>"a"</js>, <js>"1"</js>).
154    * @return This object.
155    */
156   @FluentSetter
157   public HtmlElement accesskey(String value) {
158      attr("accesskey", value);
159      return this;
160   }
161
162   /**
163    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#classes">class</a> attribute.
164    *
165    * <p>
166    * Specifies one or more CSS class names for the element, separated by spaces.
167    * These classes can be used for styling and JavaScript selection.
168    *
169    * @param _class Space-separated CSS class names (e.g., <js>"btn btn-primary"</js>).
170    * @return This object.
171    */
172   @FluentSetter
173   public HtmlElement _class(String value) {  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
174      attr("class", value);
175      return this;
176   }
177
178   /**
179    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#attr-contenteditable">contenteditable</a>
180    * attribute.
181    *
182    * <p>
183    * Indicates whether the element's content is editable by the user.
184    *
185    * <p>
186    * Possible values:
187    * <ul>
188    *    <li><js>"true"</js> or empty string - Element content is editable</li>
189    *    <li><js>"false"</js> - Element content is not editable</li>
190    *    <li><js>"plaintext-only"</js> - Element content is editable, but rich text formatting is disabled</li>
191    * </ul>
192    *
193    * @param contenteditable The editability state of the element.
194    * @return This object.
195    */
196   @FluentSetter
197   public HtmlElement contenteditable(Object value) {
198      attr("contenteditable", value);
199      return this;
200   }
201
202   /**
203    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#the-dir-attribute">dir</a> attribute.
204    *
205    * <p>
206    * Specifies the text direction of the element's content.
207    *
208    * <p>
209    * Possible values:
210    * <ul>
211    *    <li><js>"ltr"</js> - Left-to-right text direction</li>
212    *    <li><js>"rtl"</js> - Right-to-left text direction</li>
213    *    <li><js>"auto"</js> - Browser determines direction based on content</li>
214    * </ul>
215    *
216    * @param dir The text direction for the element.
217    * @return This object.
218    */
219   @FluentSetter
220   public HtmlElement dir(String value) {
221      attr("dir", value);
222      return this;
223   }
224
225   /**
226    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#the-hidden-attribute">hidden</a> attribute.
227    *
228    * <p>
229    * This attribute uses deminimized values:
230    * <ul>
231    *    <li><jk>false</jk> - Attribute is not added</li>
232    *    <li><jk>true</jk> - Attribute is added as <js>"hidden"</js></li>
233    *    <li>Other values - Passed through as-is</li>
234    * </ul>
235    *
236    * @param hidden
237    *    The new value for this attribute.
238    *    Typically a {@link Boolean} or {@link String}.
239    * @return This object.
240    */
241   @FluentSetter
242   public HtmlElement hidden(Object value) {
243      attr("hidden", deminimize(value, "hidden"));
244      return this;
245   }
246
247   /**
248    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#the-id-attribute">id</a> attribute.
249    *
250    * <p>
251    * Specifies a unique identifier for the element. The ID must be unique within the document
252    * and can be used for CSS styling, JavaScript selection, and anchor links.
253    *
254    * @param id A unique identifier for the element (e.g., <js>"header"</js>, <js>"main-content"</js>).
255    * @return This object.
256    */
257   @FluentSetter
258   public HtmlElement id(String value) {
259      attr("id", value);
260      return this;
261   }
262
263   /**
264    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#attr-lang">lang</a> attribute.
265    *
266    * <p>
267    * Specifies the primary language of the element's content using a language tag.
268    * This helps with accessibility, search engines, and browser features like spell checking.
269    *
270    * @param lang A language tag (e.g., <js>"en"</js>, <js>"en-US"</js>, <js>"es"</js>, <js>"fr-CA"</js>).
271    * @return This object.
272    */
273   @FluentSetter
274   public HtmlElement lang(String value) {
275      attr("lang", value);
276      return this;
277   }
278
279   /**
280    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onabort">onabort</a> attribute.
281    *
282    * <p>
283    * Event handler for when an operation is aborted (e.g., image loading is cancelled).
284    *
285    * @param onabort JavaScript code to execute when the abort event occurs.
286    * @return This object.
287    */
288   @FluentSetter
289   public HtmlElement onabort(String value) {
290      attr("onabort", value);
291      return this;
292   }
293
294   /**
295    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onblur">onblur</a> attribute.
296    *
297    * <p>
298    * Event handler for when the element loses focus.
299    *
300    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
301    * <p>
302    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
303    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
304    * For example:
305    * <ul>
306    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onblur(<js>"validate(\"email\")"</js>)</c>
307    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onblur(<js>"validate('email')"</js>)</c>
308    * </ul>
309    *
310    * @param onblur JavaScript code to execute when the element loses focus.
311    * @return This object.
312    */
313   @FluentSetter
314   public HtmlElement onblur(String value) {
315      attr("onblur", value);
316      return this;
317   }
318
319   /**
320    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-oncancel">oncancel</a> attribute.
321    *
322    * <p>
323    * Event handler for when a dialog is cancelled.
324    *
325    * @param oncancel JavaScript code to execute when the cancel event occurs.
326    * @return This object.
327    */
328   @FluentSetter
329   public HtmlElement oncancel(String value) {
330      attr("oncancel", value);
331      return this;
332   }
333
334   /**
335    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-oncanplay">oncanplay</a> attribute.
336    *
337    * <p>
338    * Event handler for when the media can start playing (enough data has been buffered).
339    *
340    * @param oncanplay JavaScript code to execute when the canplay event occurs.
341    * @return This object.
342    */
343   @FluentSetter
344   public HtmlElement oncanplay(String value) {
345      attr("oncanplay", value);
346      return this;
347   }
348
349   /**
350    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-oncanplaythrough">oncanplaythrough</a>
351    * attribute.
352    *
353    * <p>
354    * Event handler for when the media can play through to the end without buffering.
355    *
356    * @param oncanplaythrough JavaScript code to execute when the canplaythrough event occurs.
357    * @return This object.
358    */
359   @FluentSetter
360   public HtmlElement oncanplaythrough(String value) {
361      attr("oncanplaythrough", value);
362      return this;
363   }
364
365   /**
366    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onchange">onchange</a> attribute.
367    *
368    * <p>
369    * Event handler for when the value of a form element changes and loses focus.
370    *
371    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
372    * <p>
373    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
374    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
375    * For example:
376    * <ul>
377    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onchange(<js>"validate(\"field\")"</js>)</c>
378    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onchange(<js>"validate('field')"</js>)</c>
379    * </ul>
380    *
381    * @param onchange JavaScript code to execute when the change event occurs.
382    * @return This object.
383    */
384   @FluentSetter
385   public HtmlElement onchange(String value) {
386      attr("onchange", value);
387      return this;
388   }
389
390   /**
391    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onclick">onclick</a> attribute.
392    *
393    * <p>
394    * Event handler for when the element is clicked.
395    *
396    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
397    * <p>
398    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
399    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
400    * For example:
401    * <ul>
402    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onclick(<js>"alert(\"Hello\")"</js>)</c>
403    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onclick(<js>"alert('Hello')"</js>)</c>
404    * </ul>
405    *
406    * @param onclick JavaScript code to execute when the click event occurs.
407    * @return This object.
408    */
409   @FluentSetter
410   public HtmlElement onclick(String value) {
411      attr("onclick", value);
412      return this;
413   }
414

509    *
510    * <p>
511    * Event handler for when the element receives focus.
512    *
513    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
514    * <p>
515    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
516    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
517    * For example:
518    * <ul>
519    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onfocus(<js>"highlight(\"field\")"</js>)</c>
520    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onfocus(<js>"highlight('field')"</js>)</c>
521    * </ul>
522    *
523    * @param onfocus JavaScript code to execute when the focus event occurs.
524    * @return This object.
525    */
526   @FluentSetter
527   public HtmlElement onfocus(String value) {
528      attr("onfocus", value);
529      return this;
530   }

537    *
538    * @param oninput JavaScript code to execute when the input event occurs.
539    * @return This object.
540    */
541   @FluentSetter

556   @FluentSetter

616    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
617    * For example:
618    * <ul>
619    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onload(<js>"init(\"config\")"</js>)</c>
620    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onload(<js>"init('config')"</js>)</c>
621    * </ul>
622    *
623    * @param onload JavaScript code to execute when the load event occurs.
624    * @return This object.

664   /**
665    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onloadstart">onloadstart</a>

667    *
668    * <p>
669    * Event handler for when the browser starts loading the media.
670    *
671    * @param onloadstart JavaScript code to execute when the loadstart event occurs.
672    * @return This object.
673    */
674   @FluentSetter
675   public HtmlElement onloadstart(String value) {
676      attr("onloadstart", value);
677      return this;
678   }

760    * attribute.
761    *
762    * <p>
763    * Event handler for when the mouse pointer moves over the element (bubbles).
764    *
765    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
766    * <p>
767    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
768    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
769    * For example:
770    * <ul>
771    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onmouseover(<js>"showTooltip(\"info\")"</js>)</c>
772    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onmouseover(<js>"showTooltip('info')"</js>)</c>
773    * </ul>
774    *
775    * @param onmouseover JavaScript code to execute when the mouseover event occurs.
776    * @return This object.
777    */
778   @FluentSetter
779   public HtmlElement onmouseover(String value) {
780      attr("onmouseover", value);
781      return this;
782   }

1020    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
1021    * For example:
1022    * <ul>
1023    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onsubmit(<js>"return validate(\"form\")"</js>)</c>
1024    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onsubmit(<js>"return validate('form')"</js>)</c>
1025    * </ul>

1151   /**
1152    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#attr-tabindex">tabindex</a> attribute.
1153    *
1154    * <p>
1155    * Specifies the tab order of the element when navigating with the keyboard.
1156    *
1157    * <p>
1158    * Possible values:
1159    * <ul>
1160    *    <li>Positive integer - Element is focusable and participates in tab order</li>
1161    *    <li><js>"0"</js> - Element is focusable but not in tab order</li>
1162    *    <li>Negative integer - Element is not focusable</li>
1163    * </ul>
1164    *
1165    * @param tabindex The tab order value for keyboard navigation.
1166    * @return This object.
1167    */
1168   @FluentSetter
1169   public HtmlElement tabindex(Object value) {
1170      attr("tabindex", value);
1171      return this;
1172   }

1190   /**
1191    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#attr-translate">translate</a> attribute.
1192    *
1193    * <p>
1194    * Specifies whether the element's content should be translated when the page is localized.
1195    *
1196    * <p>
1197    * Possible values:
1198    * <ul>
1199    *    <li><js>"yes"</js> - Content should be translated (default)</li>
1200    *    <li><js>"no"</js> - Content should not be translated</li>
1201    * </ul>
1202    *
1203    * @param translate Whether the element content should be translated.
1204    * @return This object.
1205    */
1206   @FluentSetter
1207   public HtmlElement translate(Object value) {
1208      attr("translate", value);
1209      return this;
1210   }
1211
1212   /**
1213    * If the specified attribute is a boolean, it gets converted to the attribute name if <jk>true</jk> or <jk>null</jk> if <jk>false</jk>.
1214    *
1215    * @param value The attribute value.
1216    * @param attr The attribute name.
1217    * @return The deminimized value, or the same value if the value wasn't a boolean.
1218    */
1219   protected Object deminimize(Object value, String attr) {
1220      if (value instanceof Boolean b) {
1221         if (Boolean.TRUE.equals(b))
1222            return attr;
1223         return null;
1224      }
1225      return value;
1226   }
1227
1228   // <FluentSetters>
1229
1230   // </FluentSetters>
1231
1232   @Override /* Object */
1233   public String toString() {
1234      return HtmlSerializer.DEFAULT_SIMPLE_SQ.toString(this);
1235   }
1236}
